alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Windsor Forest, Downtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Montgomery, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff, Sandfly, Isle Of Hope, Whitemarsh Island, Oglethorpe Mall, Lynhurst, Lake Mayer, Cresthill, Ridgewood, Tatumsville and Fairfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
